name: Meatball Cookies
author: Sheri DeVito-Mariotto
summary: Italian, Christmas cookie, round, chocolate and spicy. The smell always gets me charged for the holidays.  The taste puts you in heaven.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)
Cream the butter margarine or shortening,  white sugar, eggs and vanilla
In a separate bowl, stir the  flour, 2/3 cup cocoa,  baking powder, baking soda, salt and spices
Add flour mixture to butter mixture
If too sticky add more flour, if too dry add a little milk
Add nuts and mix with hands
Must be of consistency to roll into little 1/2 - 1 inch balls

After you have cookie dough to handling consistency by adjusting it with either the flour or milk, roll into little balls, place on the cookie sheet and bake for about 10-12 minutes, cookie should be firm
Remove from oven, let rest on the sheet for a few moments and remove to wax paper
When cool, frost with confectioner's sugar and cocoa glaze
To Make Glaze:  Combine 4 cups confectioner's sugar, 1/4 cup cocoa, add about 1/2 cup milk
Consistency should be of a glaze
Pour small amount of glaze over each cookie (about 1 tsp
Decorate with sprinkles while glaze is still wet
